definitions.definition: One of the long benches in a church , seating several persons, usually fixed to the floor and facing the chancel .
examples: In many churches some pews are reserved for either clerical or liturgical officials such as canons, or for prominent families.

definitions.definition: An enclosed compartment in a church which provides seating for a group of people, often a prominent family.
Any structure shaped like a church pew, such as a stall , formerly used by money lenders, etc.; a box in a theatre ; or a pen or sheepfold .

main_definition: One of the long benches in a church , seating several persons, usually fixed to the floor and facing the chancel .
secondary_definitions: An enclosed compartment in a church which provides seating for a group of people, often a prominent family.
Any structure shaped like a church pew, such as a stall , formerly used by money lenders, etc.; a box in a theatre ; or a pen or sheepfold .
( colloquial , humorous ) A chair ; a seat .
